body.p:
To his excellency Beriah Magoffin
Gofernor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioner Joseph P, Murry respectfully shoeth unto ^your^ excellency that at the Nov, term of the Clay Circuit Court 1860, he was fined fifty Dollars for carrying concealed a deadly weapon to wit a pistol he states that oweing to some dificulties he had with Woodson Lyttle who had beaten him upon an occasion previous to his carrying the pistol, he did carry a pistol a few days, but he has never done so since & does not intend to again -- he states that he is quite a poor man with a family and it would greatly distress him & his family if he had said fine to pay he states that he is quite a peacable man as all his neighbours will bear witness and not disposed to have dificulties and weak in point of physical strength and entirely sober and orderly in his habits -- he therefore prays your excellency to remit sd fine
Sworn to before me By J P. Murry nov 23rd 1860
G W Price clerk c c
We the undersigned believeing that the statements of the foregoing petition are true pray to be heard in behalf of the petitioner and pray your excellency to remit sd fine.
